answers.answer: Hi there and congrats on your pregnancy.Your HCG levels look great.  Dr's will often test HCG levels every 2 to 3 days as an early indicator of a healthy pregnancy.  THey want them to double every 2 to 3 days and yours certainly did that.  Your progesterone level is good too, another indicator that things are going well.To answer your question about chances of miscarriage.  Right now things look good and that is what to focus on.  Yes, miscarriage can still happen, and odds in any pregnancy are about 33%.  However, many of those happen very very early, and every day that goes by with no bleeding (although spotting is common and usually no big deal) combined with cramping takes you closer to a positive outcome.As far as special concerns go, there is really nothing dramatic.  We "older moms" have a higher rate of things like pre eclampsia (high blood pressure), gestational diabetes and of course chromosomnal abnormalities.  DO NOT let that make you afraid.  The majority of us have completely normal and healthy pregnancies, with perhaps slightly closer monitoring.  I was a week away from 41 when my son was born and both he and I are healthy and happy.  When I say increased chance, I mean slight increases as we age, and your Dr. will order any additional tests he/she think necessary.  It truly is nothing to worry about.So enjoy that growing life inside of you and I wish you all the best!

question: I am 39 years old and 5 weeks pregnant with my second child.  Last week at 4 weeks I had bloodwork done.  My progesterone was 14.99 and my first HCG level was 249 and my second 2 days later was 628.  Can anyone tell me if this is good or what it means.  And also if HCG levels are doubling every 2 days...what are the chances of miscarriage?  What special concerns and tests can I look for this go around now that I am older with this pregnancy?
title: HCG Levels
